page.title: 09Farm Development in Codford
page.content: Mr.Stratton owns most of the land in our area.His uncle rented the farm in 1930 and Mr Stratton bought it in 1950. Before 1930 ten men milked 100 cows by hand. In 1930 with a new milking machine 3 men milked 80 cows and by 1946 2 men milked 100 cows. In 1975 with more new machinery 2 men milked 200 cows ,but in 1985 1 man milks 160 cows by using yet another new machine. In 1930 most of the farm land was used for rearing sheep and cows but now two thirds of the ground grows wheat and crops.When Mr Stratton was young there were very few tractors around.They were very hard to start up in the morning and they had no cabs,so the drivers got wet but now they have insulated cabs and they have air vents and walkie talkies connected to the farm telephone.
